questions.question: New Zealand is (almost completely covered/partially covered) by __________ and __________ radar.
How does primary radar work?
questions.answer: A signal is sent from the ground, bounces off the aircraft, and scatters. Some of the signal is picked up by the receiver. Time between transmit and receive gives distance.

questions.question: How does secondary radar work?
questions.answer: Signal from the ground-based radar aerial is received by the aircraft's transponder. The transponder sends back a signal, often encoded with an identifier.

questions.question: Radar can operate over _____ or _____ signals, both of which require line of _____.
Radar coverage is better at (higher/lower) altitudes. In what environment can receiving radar coverage be particularly difficult?
Information from all radar aerials in New Zealand is fed into a __________ __________, which is accessed by radar operators in a number of different locations.
Aircraft without a transponder can only receieve __________ radar coverage, as long as they also have an __________ __________ and are in __________ radar coverage.
Secondary radar coverage is significantly (greater/smaller) than primary radar coverage.
Transponders normally have two modes: __________ and __________.
What information does a Mode A transponder send?
questions.answer: A four-digit code entered by the pilot.

questions.question: What information does a Mode C transponder send?
questions.answer: The same as a Mode A transponder, plus altitude information.

questions.question: What are the four functions typically found a transponder? Give a brief description of each.
questions.answer: OFF: don't transmit. SBY: transponder is on but will not respond to interrogation. ON: transponder will respond to Mode A interrogation. ALT: transponder will respond to Mode C interrogation.

questions.question: What are the three transponder distress codes, and what do they mean?
The primary functions of radar service are to provide __________ for aircraft in controlled airspace, and assist __________ _____ __________.
What are three other types of information that may be available from radar controllers?
questions.answer: Navigation assistance (eg. recommended tracks, vectors), traffic information, weather information.
